results.title: The Wizard of speed and time
results.creator_credit: Mike Jittlou Productions, Mike Jittlov and Deven Chierighino
results.brief_description: An examination of pixillation technique. From a mountain cave blasts a green wizard, skimming along the highway at incredible speed until slipping on a banana peel. Then from beneath the wreckage of a shattered movie studio, he magically resurrects every piece of equipment and celebrates with song and sparkles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Jittlou Productions, Mike Jittlov and Deven Chierighino

results.title: The Wizard of Oz. - 50th anniversary ed. (S) (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Mervyn LeRoy, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Victor Fleming
results.brief_description: The 50th Anniversary Commemorative edition of one of the most popular and successful children’s films ever made. This is a beautifully restored technicolour print with the opening Kansas scenes in warm, sepia tones. Featuring film clips and reconstructed musical numbers cut from the original film, this magical fantasy will entertain adults and children. Based on the book by Frank L. Baum and starring Judy Garland, Ray Bolger and Margaret Hamilton.

results.title: The Wizard of Oz [1922]
results.brief_description: The classic story of Dorothy who is swept away to the magical land of Oz with her uncle and a couple of hired hands by a cyclone on her 18th birthday. Here they meet weird and wonderful characters and enjoy the adventure of a lifetime. This classic children’s story by L. Frank Baum was adapted for this early silent feature film by the author’s son, five years after his father’s death, along with top Hollywood comedian Larry Semon. Unlike the famous Judy Garland version of the story, there are no witches in Semon’s film, and the Scarecrow, Tin Woodsman and Cowardly Lion are only disguises for other characters to don.

results.title: The Wizard of No
results.creator_credit: J Gary Mitchell Film Company, J. Gary Mitchell and Jon Olinghouse
results.brief_description: Thirteen-year-old Billy is not the most popular boy in class. The Wizard of No suggests that his lack of popularity is directly related to his inability to say “no”. Points out that the word “no” has both a positive and a negative sense. Follows on with advertising and drug education segments.

results.title: The Wizard from Oz - James Morrison
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone, John Ossher and Don Featherstone Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Creative Spirits Series”.
A personal perspective on the life and music of jazz multi-instrumentalist, James Morrison. He heads us through the documentary in a series of statements derived from interviews at a variety of locations - from an empty jazz club in the afternoon, to a studio in New York, seated among some of the finest international jazz musicians of the last fifty years. We encounter his family, his musical colleagues, friends and critics and learn about Jazz and about James Morrison: musician, composer, dare-devil and philosopher, and we listen to his music.

results.title: The Witch who was afraid of witches
results.creator_credit: Robert McDonald, Noyes Productions and Eliot Noyes
results.brief_description: The youngest witch in her family, Wendy has the weakest witch power. She can hardly take off on her broomstick. She can’t say spells in a scary voice. She can’t even cackle. Worst of all, she is afraid of witches - older, bossy, mean witches like her two older sisters. Always feeling left out, afraid of the dark, afraid of witches, Wendy goes to bed at night hugging her broomstick, which at least gives her a little witch power…until the day before Halloween, when she loses it! Now she has no witch power at all. Left alone on Halloween night, Wendy meets a friend and magically discovers special powers that she has always desired. At first, she uses the spells to seek revenge, but soon she realises her folly, takes off the spells, and earns the sought-after respect and love of her sisters. Based on book by Alice Low. Narrated by Kathryn Walker. Voices by Denise Lute, Diane Salinger, Eliot Noyes.

results.title: The Winning breed
results.brief_description: The film looks at the breeding of thoroughbred racehorses. Important factors in breeding are discussed and the film surveys some of the activities and a variety of horses which are found in several Australian stud farms owned by Wright Stevensons.

results.title: The Winger with Gordon Hill
results.creator_credit: Ray Marshall, Terry Ryan and Opix Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus on Soccer”.
Gordon Hill, Derby’s left-winger, shows that speed, accurate crossing and dribbling are vitally important to the winger’s game.

results.title: The Winged scourge
results.brief_description: Points out that the Anopheles mosquito alone transmits malaria and shows its development from the larva to full growth when it becomes a menace. Various means of combating the mosquito are demonstrated.
results.description: Points out that the Anopheles mosquito alone transmits malaria and shows its development from the larva to full growth when it becomes a menace. Various means of combating the mosquito are demonstrated.

results.title: The Winged go-betweens
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Scientific and Educational Film Studio and Miu Chin
results.brief_description: A nature film on the life of bees, concentrating in particular on their most useful function - the pollination of flowers. Using close-ups the camera reveals the work and behaviour of these insects in a way rarely seen before on the screen. A fascinating insight into their world.
